DOC.brief_summary: Intensive chemotherapy is associated with significant thrombocytopenia, often requiring platelet transfusion to maintain platelet counts. This investigational drug has been demonstrated to increase platelet counts. This study will test the safety and efficacy of the investigational drug in the prevention of thrombocytopenia in patients with recurrent or refractory intermediate-grade or high-grade non-Burkitt's, non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL), or Hodgkin's disease receiving DHAP (Dexamethasone, high-dose Cytarabine, and Cisplatin) chemotherapy.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of (PN-152,243)/PN-196,444 in the Prevention of Thrombocytopenia
DOC.criteria: Patients must have recurrent or refractory intermediategrade or highgrade nonBurkitt's, nonHodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) or Hodgkin's disease and be scheduled for a minimum of 2 cycles of DHAP (Dexamethasone, highdose Cytarabine and Cisplatin) chemotherapy Patients must not have active bleeding (exclusions do apply) or history of platelet disorder
